intro: Lippia bradeana, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, often fragrant leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Lippia bradeana is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in various environmental conditions.
